results.title: Silversmith
results.brief_description: The work of the silversmith is essentially that of a craftsman unassisted by modern methods of mass production. The beauty and delicacy of his hand-made creations in silver and leather make him one of the most versatile of craftsmen. This film shows the many processes involved in the creation of fine silverware, together with the tools which have been used for centuries without change.

results.title: Silverbeat = Silverbeet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The 50’s saw a massive intake of young immigrants from Europe, but as these immigrants approach old age the community is encountering problems in how best to cope with their needs, which may be very different from those of the anglo-saxon community to which most retirement and nursing homes are geared. Most of these people come from cultures in which it is not accepted practice to put the aged into institutions. This program looks at two different approaches to the problem - firstly by setting up retirement villages specifically aimed at particular immigrant groups, and secondly by initiating a variety of ethnic foods into the regime of a mixed retirement home.

results.title: Silverado [DVD]
results.brief_description: Silverado is an old west frontier town in the evil grip of a corrupt and powerful, smiling-viper sheriff (Brian Dennehy). But things are about to change around town. Four unlikely heroes - brothers Emmett (Scott Glenn) and Jake (Kevin Costner), adventurer Paden (Kevin Kline), and a crack-shot negro cowboy (Danny Glover)- saddle up for a series of dangerous adventures on the dusty trail to Silverado. From its explosive, breathtaking opening gun battle to a final, tense high-noon shoot-out, this thrilling, hell-for-leather western is bursting with spectacular action. This is director Kasdan’s tribute to the great and much-loved tradition of the Wild West.

results.title: Silver City
results.brief_description: While travelling by train to Sydney, Nina, a teacher of Polish extraction meets a fellow Pole, Julian, whom she has not seen for many years. They recall their time at “Silver City” the camp for new Australians where they met in 1949. She was drawn to Julian from the start, it did not matter to her that he was married with a child, and they began an affair. Unable to become a teacher at this time due to her lack of qualifications, Nina takes on a job as a domestic in a country hospital. She is then transferred to a camp near Sydney where she again meets up with Julian. Together they are befriended by two Australians and begin to experience the positive side of their new lives in Australia. But when Julian returns to his wife, Nina is devastated. By 1962 she has fulfilled her desire to become a teacher, yet she remains alone.

results.title: Silver Blaze
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Called in to solve the baffling case involving the famous racehorse, Silver Blaze, Sherlock Holmes and Watson arrive at the small village of Tavistock to discover that the police have already arrested a suspect. However the detective uncovers discrepancies. He retraces the events of the night of the crime and ultimately comes to a surprising solution. Cast includes Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Silver's new shine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Today silver plays a new role in Britain. Since 1947 it has ceased to be used in British coinage and is put to work more and more widely in a variety of industries. Old silver coins are refined at the Royal Mint, to supply industry with more of this precious mineral, also used in the fine silver work for which Britain’s silversmith’s are traditionally famous.

results.title: Silver
results.creator_credit: Ultima Vez, Quasi Modo and Wim Vandekeybus
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. Drawing his dance vocabulary from everyday movements, his style is high adrenaline with genuine sense of jeopardy. Vandekeybus used an Irish nursery rhyme as a basis for his performance ‘7 for a Secret never to be told’ (1997). The performance was made up of seven interflowing sections, alluding to ‘two extreme emotions, the two sexes, two precious metals and a secret’. For each scene a specific scenography and different movement material was developed. This dance video is an adaptation of the fifth scene of the performance. Music, Thierry De Mey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ultima Vez, Quasi Modo and Wim Vandekeybus

results.title: Silver
results.brief_description: Footage of various facets of the silver smithing process - the production of sterling silver cutlery, engraving of silver platters, how silver is used to produce mirrors, and the importance of silver to the photographic process. Silent short produced for classroon instructional purposes.

results.title: Silly symphonies. Limited gold edition
results.brief_description: Silly Symphonies is a delightful presentation of seven animations from the Disney studios which are not focused on a main character or a plot but rather bring to life inanimate objects, cakes and plates as well as insects and animals. These more experimental animations allowed the animators freedom and expression developing new ideas and animation techniques. These innovative animations are exciting and a joy to watch.

results.title: Silly symphonies
results.brief_description: Three Walt Disney cartoon classics from the Silly Symphony series which are sure to enchant and delight children of all ages. Walt Disney’s “Silly Symphonies” were produced over a ten-year period from 1929-1939 and have managed to continue charming and entertaining viewing audiences of all ages into the 21st century.
